properties.areaDesc: Southern Brevard County; Martin; Northern Brevard County; St. Lucie; Indian River; Coastal Volusia
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 31 at 3:58AM EST until January 31 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Rough surf and a Moderate Risk of rip currents expected.

* WHERE...Volusia, Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie and Martin
counties.

* WHEN...Expect rough surf and rip currents through 6 pm.

* IMPACTS...Incoming swells will produce rough surf and life
threatening rip currents.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...To reduce your risk of becoming caught in
the seaward pull of a rip current, swim only within sight of a
lifeguard, and never swim alone.
properties.instruction:
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON
